IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: SUPPORTS AND EMPOWERS PEOPLE WITH INTELLECTUAL AND OTHER LIFE CHALLENGES TO ACHIEVE THEIR INDIVIDUAL GOALS AND ASPIRATIONS IN A HIGHLY PERSONALIZED, SAFE AND ENRICHING ENVIRONMENT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: SUPPORTS AND EMPOWERS PEOPLE WITH INTELLECTUAL AND OTHER LIFE CHALLENGES TO ACHIEVE THEIR INDIVIDUAL GOALS AND ASPIRATIONS IN A HIGHLY PERSONALIZED, SAFE AND ENRICHING ENVIRONMENT.
IRS990.Desc: COMMUNITY RESIDENCES - 24-HOUR RESIDENTIAL SUPPORTS FOR ADULTS WITH INTELLECTUAL DISABILITIES AND OTHER DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, INCLUDING CLINICAL SUPPORTS, CASE MANAGEMENT AND VOCATIONAL SUPPORTS; ALLOWS A PERSON WITH THESE DISABILITIES THE OPPORTUNITY TO LIVE IN A RESIDENTIAL SETTING WHILE RECEIVING THE INTENSIVE SERVICES NECESSARY FOR SUCCESSFUL LONG-TERM STABILITY. APPROXIMATELY 145 CLIENTS SERVED DURING FISCAL YEAR 2018.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: RESIDENTIAL RESPITE - SHORT-TERM EMERGENCY SUPPORTS FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN A HOME-LIKE ENVIRONMENT. SERVICES INCLUDE STABILIZING INDIVIDUALS BY PROVIDING SUPPORT AND TREATMENT AND A SAFE ENVIRONMENT; AND TO WORK AGGRESSIVELY IN SUPPORTING THE INDIVIDUAL TO RETURN HOME OR TO A MORE APPROPRIATE RESIDENTIAL SETTING. APPROXIMATELY 20 CLIENTS SERVED DURING FISCAL YEAR 2018.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: COMMUNITY BASED DAY SUPPORTS - PROVIDES PARTNERSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY EMPLOYERS, NON-PROFITS AND LOCAL RESOURCES AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH VOLUNTEERING, PURSUING HOBBIES/SPECIAL INTERESTS AND PARTICIPATING IN SOCIAL AND ENRICHMENT ACTIVITIES. APPROXIMATELY 53 CLIENTS SERVED DURING FISCAL YEAR 2018.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: INTENSIVE FLEXIBLE FAMILY SUPPORT - ASSISTANCE TO PARENTS AND OTHER PRIMARY CAREGIVERS IN THEIR EFFORTS TO PROVIDE CARE IN THE HOME AND COMMUNITY FOR AN INDIVIDUAL WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES. APPROXIMATELY 29 CLIENTS SERVED DURING FISCAL YEAR 2018.

IN-HOME SUPPORTS - FOR INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN THEIR OWN HOMES WHO REQUIRE LESS THAN 24/7 SUPPORTS. SUPPORTS ARE BASED ON LIFE PLANNING STRATEGIES AND COACHING, INCLUDING COMPETENCE IN HOUSEHOLD MANAGEMENT, SOCIAL AND RECREATION PLANNING, MONEY MANAGEMENT, TRANSPORTATION, PHYSICAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH MAINTENANCE, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, MEAL PREPARATION AND SELF-ADVOCACY.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: OTHER INCOME HUD PROJECT ADMINISTRATION FEES

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION ACTS AS FIDUCIARY WITH RESPECT TO CERTAIN PERSONAL CLIENT FUNDS IT RECEIVES AS A REPRESENTATIVE PAYEE. THESE FUNDS ARE NOT THE PROPERTY OF THE ORGANIZATION AND ARE HELD IN TRUST IN SEPARATE ACCOUNTS ON BEHALF OF THE CLIENTS.

IN CONNECTION WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S BOND ISSUANCE DATED MAY 2, 2013, THE ORGANIZATION HAS AGREED TO COMPLY WITH THE ARBITRAGE REBATE REQUIREMENTS OF SECTION 148(F) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. IN MARCH 2018, THE ORGANIZATION CONSULTED WITH NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED BOND COUNSEL AND DETERMINED THAT THE ARBITRAGE REBATE CALCULATION DUE MAY 2, 2018 WAS NOT REQUIRED. THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT REQUIRED TO PERFORM THE NEXT REBATE CALCULATION UNTIL MAY 2, 2023.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT HAVE ANY COMMITTEES WITH THE AUTHORITY TO ACT ON BEHALF OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S PRESIDENT/CEO AND CFO/TREASURER REVIEW A DRAFT OF THE FORM 990, WHICH IS PREPARED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANTS. ANY COMMENTS RESULTING FROM THE REVIEW PROCESS ARE INCORPORATED INTO THE FORM BY THE INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANTS. A FINAL VERSION OF THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO ITS FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OFFICERS, DIRECTORS AND EXECUTIVE PERSONNEL MUST DISCLOSE IN WRITING TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FINANCIAL INTERESTS, OTHER BOARD MEMBERSHIPS, AND THE TOTAL AMOUNT RECEIVED FROM DELTA PROJECTS FOR SERVICES RENDERED TO THE ORGANIZATION OR AS A VENDOR OF GOODS TO THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS COMPENSATION OF EXECUTIVES OF SIMILAR SIZE ORGANIZATIONS IN DETERMINING THE PRESIDENT/CEO'S COMPENSATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC VIA THE WEBSITES OF CERTAIN STATE REGULATORY AGENCIES. GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
